Join Camping World in this exciting opportunity.

At ABB, we help industries outrun - leaner and cleaner. Here, progress is an expectation - for you, your team, and the world. As a global market leader, weâ€™ll give you what you need to make it happen. It wonâ€™t always be easy, growing takes grit. But at ABB, youâ€™ll never run alone. Run what runs the world.This Position reports to:Salesforce Product Owner for Marketing and SalesÂ As an intern, you will have the opportunity to gain practical experience through various projects. Each day, you will acquire knowledge by performing tasks as directed. You will also showcase your skills by supporting ABBâ€™s operations and enhancing personal education/employment opportunities.The work model for the role is onsite/hybrid in Cary, NC.You will be mainly accountable for:Collaborating with Agile team members including developers, administrators, product owners, and business analysts.Participating in daily stand-ups, sprint planning, retrospectives, and other Agile ceremonies.Assisting in the design, development, testing, and deployment of Salesforce solutions.Supporting user story grooming and documentation.Helping to troubleshoot and resolve issues within the Salesforce platform.Conducting research and provide recommendations for Salesforce best practices and enhancements.Contributing to the creation of training materials and user documentation.Qualifications for the role:Currently enrolled in a bachelor's or masterâ€™s degree program in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business or a related field, in the United States. Knowledgeable or have working experience in Agile Methodologies (Scrum, Kanban).Familiar with cloud platforms such as salesforce.com AWS, Azure.Intern must have reliable transportation to and from the worksite. Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without company sponsorshipÂ now and in the future. Utilize critical thinking skills to analyze complex situations and develop strategic solutions.Effectively organize and prioritize tasks to meet deadlines.Exhibit the capability to manage several tasks at once while maintaining high standards of quality.Collaborate with team members to convey ideas, share information, and provide updates on project progress.Why ABB? Â What's in it for youWe want you to bring your full self to workâ€”your ideas, your energy, your ambition. Youâ€™ll have the tools and freedom to grow your skills, shape your path, and take on challenges that matter. Here, your work creates impact you can see and feel, every day.ABB is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer for protected Veterans and Individuals with Disabilities at ABB.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their- sex (gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation), marital status, citizenship, age,Â  race and ethnicity, inclusive of traits historically associated with race or ethnicity, including but not limited to hair texture and protective hairstyles, color, religious creed, national origin, pregnancy, physical or mental disability, genetic information, protected Veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal and state law.For more information regarding your (EEO) rights as an applicant, please visit the following websites: https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/2023-06/22-088_EEOC_KnowYourRights6.12ScreenRdr.pdfAs an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer for Protected Veterans and Individuals with Disabilities, applicants may request to review the plan of a particular ABB facility between the hours of 9:00 A.M. - 5:00 P.M. EST Monday through Friday by contacting an ABB HR Representative at 1-888-694-7762.Protected Veterans and Individuals with Disabilities may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access ABB's career site as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling an ABB HR Representative at 1-888-694-7762 or by sending an email to US-AskHR@abb.com. Resumes and applications will not be accepted in this manner. Internships at ABB within the United States are not eligible for company-sponsored medical benefits, 401(k) contributions, or paid time off.Â The hourly rate is determined by things such as the successful applicantâ€™s qualifications, graduation year and experience. This position is expected to pay between $20 - $34 per hour.Â We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe.

If you have what it takes to become part of the Vistra family and would like to start a promising career with a global leader, take a look at the exciting employment opportunities that are currently available and apply online.Job SummaryðŸ“Œ About VistraVistra is a Fortune 500 integrated retail electricity and power generation company. Our Power Optimization Center (POC) leverages advanced monitoring, diagnostics, and optimization technologies to ensure reliability, efficiency, and innovation across our diverse fleet of generation assets â€” including solar power.ðŸš€ Internship OverviewWe are seeking a Summer 2026 Intern to join our POC team with a focus on Solar Power Generation systems and operations. This role is ideal for students pursuing renewable energy, electrical engineering, or related disciplines who want to apply their academic knowledge to real-world challenges in the energy sector. Interns will gain exposure to solar plant performance monitoring, diagnostics, and optimization strategies that support efficient and sustainable operations.Job DescriptionðŸ›  Key ResponsibilitiesAssist in analyzing solar plant operational data to identify performance trends, anomalies, and optimization opportunities.Support the development of diagnostic tools and models for solar system monitoring.Collaborate with engineers to evaluate efficiency metrics, reliability indicators, and renewable integration strategies.Contribute to projects that enhance workflow automation and visualization systems for solar operations.Document findings and present project outcomes to the POC team and leadership.Will be assigned various engineering projects.ã€€Comply with safety policy and procedures to ensure a safe working environmentPossess the ability to work independently and in a fast paced environmentAll other duties as assignedðŸŽ“ QualificationsPursuing a Bachelorâ€™s or Masterâ€™s degree in Renewable Energy, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, or related field.Familiarity with solar power systems, photovoltaic technology, or energy generation fundamentals.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with interest in data-driven decision-making.Proficiency in at least one programming language (Python, MATLAB, C++, or similar) preferred.Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.Excellent communication skills for presenting technical concepts clearly.Must be a U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident.
